direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods manipulate the class attribute of an element, but in opposite directions (adding vs. removing).
Both methods involve modifying the class attribute, with toggleClass adding or removing based on the current state.
Both methods access and modify the attributes of an element, specifically focusing on the class attribute.
Both methods involve removing attributes from an element, though removeAttr is more general.
The classNames method provides the set of class names that are manipulated by removeClass.
The hasClass method checks for the presence of a class, which is relevant for the operation of removeClass.
The classNames method with a set parameter is used to set the class names, which is related to the removal operation in removeClass.
